item.title: Are Electric Fireplaces Energy Efficient?
item.description: Yes, electric fireplaces are 100% efficient. But at the same time, they output just ~20% of the total heat a wood-burning stove would output.

item.title: How to make an Infrared Heater more efficient?
item.description: You can increase your infrared heater's perceived efficiency through room insulation and proper placement within your room.

item.title: How to insulate a Window AC (for Efficiency)
item.description: You can add insulation around a window AC by gluing styrofoam panels around the sides. To close all air gaps, use spray foam or foam tape.

item.title: How to make a Window AC more efficient (9 Methods)
item.description: You can make your window AC more efficient by insulating windows, gaps below your door. Clean the evaporator coil and air filter.

item.title: How to Improve Oil-filled Radiator Efficiency
item.description: Oil-filled radiators are 100% efficient. You can improve its perceived efficiency (the amount of heat reaching you) through proper placement.

item.title: 13 Ways to Improve Wood Stove Efficiency
item.description: To improve your wood stove’s efficiency, use a firewood holder, install a wood stove insert or a reflective wall heat shield.

item.title: Do Space Heaters Save Money?
item.description: Space heaters only save you money if you reduce your central heating's temperature by 4°F - 8°F or more and you supply heat in used rooms.

item.title: How to make a Portable Air Conditioner More Efficient?
item.description: You can make your portable air conditioner more efficient by insulating the exhaust hose. Also, ensure that your room is well-insulated.
